subject: Add Resource dump support
commitMessage:
Add Resource dump support

To build use option -Dhost-transport=pldm and
-Dopenpower-dumps-extension=enabled
Add support for resource dump operations like
creation and offloading.
Tests:(Dump manager tests)
  Created dump entry.
  Faked notify to check whether progress is turning to completed.

Signed-off-by: Dhruvaraj Subhashchandran <dhruvaraj@in.ibm.com>
Change-Id: Ifeec5670a7806d7ee1b572158b4fff7dc14729a6

why not get as input inside updating by hard coding ?
Thinking: do we lose update() function responsibility?
The update is only when the operation is completed, we can change this later if at all we handle abort or error.
same as LN 81.
This will be hardcoded, this is the best place to find the completed time
not critical but these can go before line 66, declare variables at place of usage.

Do you need to update progress status for user initiated dump case?
the notify comes only if he dump is completed, so we can set it as completed, error case will be handled separetly
Ok, Do we need to add TODO with issue number to track?
TODO is there inside the function, this function may not change but we add some new report error function.

ya reverting this

yes

will add the same mechanism to check whether host is up

Can you change system offload then? because, currently we did not handle such case for system dump offload.
https://github.com/openbmc/phosphor-debug-collector/blob/master/dump-extensions/openpower-dumps/system_dump_entry.cpp#L13

Separate patch will be good or Add in this patch and update commit as well.
that was something you could add.. but anyway I will push a commit for that

we can change all at once, why some experimental and some new one

Done
Do you need to add TODO for issue #2597
Done
#2597 is needed for all properties here, so no need to mention that explicitely

I guess, pldm file type will be differ for resource dump. Please check with pldm team, I remember they said it will be different.

If it is different, then we won't see expected result here i.e current used host::requestDelete() -> pldm::requestDelete() (I guess you expected pldm ibm specific command in your flow, because your dbus sitting under com/ibm so, it will ibm specific pldm::requestDelete()) will request host system dump. So, we need to pass type of dump.

Reference: https://github.com/openbmc/phosphor-debug-collector/blob/master/host-transport-extensions/pldm/oem/ibm/pldm_oem_cmds.cpp#L160

> // - PLDM_FILE_TYPE_DUMP - To indicate FileAck for Host system dump
Please respond for this if not handling in this patch,
this change is in a different commit now
vsp and pwd needs only for create?  not for offload/delete later to system initiated dump ?
yes only for create

elog will throw exception (https://github.com/openbmc/phosphor-logging/blob/master/phosphor-logging/elog.hpp#L166) so, return empty path is no effect, so caller of this api need to take care right to catch exception or how error handling will happen caller side ?
yes but this practice is there in this code,so just keeping it. and if the empty string is returned caller is taking it as an error

> if the empty string is returned caller is taking it as an error

return statement won't execute right ? so, I hope caller need to take care both.
the caller is taking care of that, anyway, that is a basic validation on the caller end.
same as 84 comment,
same just keeping the practice

I think you can use utility function (isHostRunning()) which is introduced in https://gerrit.openbmc-project.xyz/c/openbmc/phosphor-debug-collector/+/39163 patch by rebasing patches if not (I guess, this patch is on top of utility function patch based on relation chain).
Done
